column1: 1 ^ Dòminus regnávit~; exsùltet terra~; laĕtèntur ìnsulaĕ mùltaĕ. ^ The Lord hath reigned~; let the earth rejoice~; let many islands be glad.
2 ^ nubes et calígo in circùmitu ejus~; justìtia et judìcium corréctio sedis ejus. ^ Clouds and darkness are round about him~; justice and judgment are the establishment of his throne.

column2: et inflammábit in circùmitu inimícos ejus. ^ A fire shall go before him
column3: and shall burn his enemies round about.

column1: 4 ^ Illuxérunt fùlgura ejus orbi terraĕ~; vîdit
column2: et commóta est terra. ^ His lightnings have shone forth to the world~; the earth saw and trembled.

column1: 5 ^ Mòntes sicut cera fluxérunt a fácie Dòmini~; a fácie Dòmini òmnis terraĕ. ^ The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the Lord~; at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.

column2: et vîdérunt òmnes pòpuli glóriam ejus. ^ The heavens declared his justice
column3: and all people saw his glory.

column2: et qŭi gloriántur in simulácrîs suîs. Adoráte eum òmnes ángeli ejus. ^ Let them be all confounded that adore graven things
column3: and that glory in their idols. Adore him
et exsultavérunt fíliaĕ Judaĕ pròpter judìcia tua
column4: Dòmine. ^ Sion heard and was glad
column5: and the daughters of Judah rejoiced because of thy judgments

column1: 9 ^ Qŭóniam tu Dòminus Altìssimus super òmnem terram~; nìmis exaltátus es super òmnes Deos. ^ For thou art the most high Lord over all the earth~; thou art exalted exceedingly above all gods.

column2: odíte malum~; custódit Dòminus ánimas sanctórum suórum~; de manu peccatóris liberábit eos. ^ You that love the Lord
column3: hate evil~; the Lord preserveth the souls of his saints~; he will deliver them out of the hand of the sinner.

column2: et rectîs corde laĕtìtia. ^ Light is risen to the just
column3: and joy to the right of heart.

column4: et confitémini memóriaĕ sanctificatiónis ejus. ^ Rejoice
column7: and give praise to the remembrance of his holiness.
